page.title: 04ROADS AND TRANSPORT
page.content: The{A51}in Woore is called the London Road below the Square, and above the Square it is called Nantwich Road. In the past it was the on the stage coach route from London to Holyhead. The {A525,}which crosses it in the Square, is one of the holiday routes to North Wales from the Midlands. There used to be a{railway station at {Pipe Gate,}but this was closed during the 1950's. Crosville run their green buses to Crewe and to the Potteries. Jones Coachways run a bus service to Market Drayton on Wednesdays, Market Day. Our survey showed that{17 of the 26 {families we asked never used public {transport. There is a{Voluntary Car Scheme}in the village, so that people who do not have their own cars can be taken to urgent appointments.
